parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A place, piece of land, field, property, estate. Diminutive of chora; a spot or plot of ground.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Of Chaldee origin; oil-press; Gethsemane, a garden near Jerusalem.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
